thread.title: This Is How Celebrities Reacted To The Trump Inauguration
thread.title_full: This Is How Celebrities Reacted To The Trump Inauguration

author: David Fischer
title: This Is How Celebrities Reacted To The Trump Inauguration
text:
Many around were watching live on TV yesterday, as President Donald Trump was sworn into office, as the 45th commander-in-chief of the United States. Not only were many protesting at the same time, the new President was also relentlessly attacked by many, especially celebrities, on social media, while holding his inauguration speech. See here below some of the reactions to yesterday‚Äôs happenings from A-list starts from the worlds of film, music, television, and modelling.
Frank Ocean wrote a lengthy commentary on his Tumblr page:
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt cook the books either Donald. We all know your event was dry. No matter how many times CNN anchors repeat majestic or peaceful transition of power. The world can see America divided and the chaos in the streets. Barack we love you but it would‚Äôve been equally presidential if you would‚Äôve just walked on out while Donald got through that struggle speech trashing your career. The majority knows man, we know you did good. We see it. The majority sees Donald for who he is too. He ain‚Äôt slick. And it‚Äôs too bad the majority doesn‚Äôt count. In any event, a first family that I can relate to will be missed. Really though.‚Äù
Model Chrissy Teigen was not very amused either and took things to Twitter.
what a beautiful prayer. makes me wanna grab my puss
‚Äî christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) January 20, 2017 

i was going to go to sundance to support john tomorrow but feeling compelled to support my fellow women. see you at the women's march, DC
‚Äî christine teigen (@chrissyteigen) January 20, 2017 

Rihanna made it clear that she was going to miss Obama.
worst breakup ever. üôåüèø 
A photo posted by badgalriri (@badgalriri) on Jan 20, 2017 at 9:22am PST 

Comedian Sarah Silverman also took it to Twitter.
This is the most I've ever heard the words Jesus Christ and the most I've ever said the words Jesus Christ
‚Äî Sarah Silverman (@SarahKSilverman) January 20, 2017 

Katy Perry did not really want to see what was happening.
sleeping in
‚Äî KATY PERRY (@katyperry) January 20, 2017 

Chris Rock was also not very happy and advises us all to set our clocks back in time‚Ä¶. 300 years.
pic.twitter.com/V5ziwMJiOV 
‚Äî Chris Rock (@chrisrock) January 20, 2017 

John Legend points out that not nearly as many people as for the Obama inauguration were present at this one.
The last 2 inaugurations were very crowded. This one is so‚Ä¶ roomy
‚Äî John Legend (@johnlegend) January 20, 2017 

Of course Michael Moore had something to say as well!
An Alternate Inaugural Address: My reading of Langston Hughes' "Let America Be America Again" (1935) on Trump's Day https://t.co/A2kc4JVsF2 
‚Äî Michael Moore (@MMFlint) January 20, 2017 

Alicia Keys gets in on the conversation as well.
. @realDonaldTrump Americans are all colors, faiths, cultures & genders. We have voices. We refuse fear. We believe in the Dream. #WeAreHere 
‚Äî Alicia Keys (@aliciakeys) January 20, 2017 

Adele also salutes Obama.
‚úåüèª pic.twitter.com/XlcB8deroc 
‚Äî Adele (@Adele) January 20, 2017
